p: Pablo Tebas (University of Pennsylvania, USA) presented recent progress in advancing HIV-1 gene therapy. Gene engineering of autologous CD4 T cells or CD34 + hematopoietic stem cells to block HIV-1 infection has been a popular approach. The method uses strategies that involve harvesting cells from patients, manipulation and selection ex vivo followed by reinfusion [27]. Valuable information for developing this technology was derived from the understanding of processes underlying the cure of Timothy Brown, the ‘Berlin patient’.
